statement_html:
Use the method of diagonalization to transform the following system of equations into a decoupled one:

\(\displaystyle x' = \begin{pmatrix} 4 & 2\\ 2 & 1 \end{pmatrix} x + \begin{pmatrix} t e^{t^2} \end{pmatrix}\)

and you must explicitly calculate all matrices involved. Here

\(\displaystyle x(t) = \begin{pmatrix} x_1(t)\\ x_2(t)\end{pmatrix} .\) You do not need to solve the system.
